natural in this world.

1404.47.text:
NARRATOR: And for the future
of a growing San Antonio,

1407.17.text:
this natural area could
not be more important.

1411.84.text:
CONNALLY: Even if a member of
the community doesn't access

1414.98.text:
the property for recreational
reasons or education,

1418.42.text:
they still reap the benefits of
having Government Canyon

1421.55.text:
in their own backyard to provide
water quality protection.

1427.73.text:
DEIRDRE: We talk
about the science,

1428.99.text:
we talk about the water,
the one thing that

1432.13.text:
always seems to get
overlooked is getting off

1436.13.text:
the concrete and having
reflective soulful time,

1441.17.text:
it's just an incredible
jewel for San Antonio.

1498.30.text:
PIT MASTER: Come on, as long
as Jim doesn't get in here.

1504.44.text:
MAN 2: We need to stand over
her with a fire extinguisher.

1507.24.text:
PHOTOGRAPHER: What you got
going there?

1511.68.text:
PIT MASTER: Yessir,
free range yardbirds.

1564.76.text:
NARRATOR: This series is funded
in part by a grant from the

1567.30.text:
Wildlife and Sport Fish
Restoration Program.

1570.34.text:
Through your purchases of
hunting and fishing equipment,

1572.87.text:
and motorboat fuels,
over 40 million dollars

1575.51.text:
in conservation efforts are
funded in Texas each year.

1581.05.text:
Additional funding
provided by Ram Trucks.
